pullRequest.body:
We have a lot of `erw`s and `rfl`s in files dealing with concrete categories. This seems to be mostly due to the existence of two casts: `ConcreteCategory.hasCoeToSort` and `Bundled.coeSort` which both represent the forgetful functor from concrete categories to Type. The first is only a local instance but is needed to state lemmas on these concrete categories, while the second one is always available but only applies to categories defined as `Bundled`. The casts are defeq but not reducibly so, causing issues when rewriting with generic lemmas in the context of a specific `Bundled` category.
    
For some specific categories we already have a workaround: a unification hint of the form `âŠ¢ (forget CommRingCat).obj R â‰Ÿ R` also fires at reducible transparency. This PR does the same for any category of the form `Bundled _`, fixing a lot of the issues. Almost all of the changes in this PR consists of `erw` to `rw` or removing a terminal `rfl`.

A limitation of this approach is that the unification hint isn't taken into account when building discrimination trees, so e.g. `simp` still doesn't know how to apply these kinds of lemmas. An alternative might involve unbundling the `CoeSort` from `ConcreteCategory`, but that doesn't actually fix anything! Namely, we have to write `CoeSort.coe` in the generic lemmas, but the coercion is inlined for specific instances. (Here a unification hint might also help, but then we'd be back at this PR essentially.)
    
There used to be some regressions because the subtle unification order gets disrupted: where we expected `CommRingCat` (with many useful instances) now we get `Bundled CommRing`. Since #17612 turns `CommRingCat` into an `abbrev`, that is no longer an issue.


---

- [ ] depends on: #17612

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message

- ...

nodes.body:
### PR summary [bbe04be5a3](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17583/commits/bbe04be5a3862c4431abed4c69c8d848d2433f42)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`- instance : CoeSort CommRingCat Type*`
`- instance : ConcreteCategory CommRingCat := by`
`- instance : ConcreteCategory CommSemiRingCat := by`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

So there is a bit of regression in the area of sheaves, most of which is easy enough to fix. But most definitions in `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.QuasiSeparated` seem to just completely fail because their expected `CommRingCat` becomes `Bundled CommRing`, meaning all their nice instances are gone. Adding type ascriptions doesn't seem to help, so I'm going to try and see if the issue can be resolved a bit higher up...

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/7cea2d9a-2ac2-4f69-abb8-213cdcae395a) for commit bbe04be5a3862c4431abed4c69c8d848d2433f42.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.

:v: Vierkantor can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#17612~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!

pullRequest.title: chore: add unification hint for forgetful functor Bundled -> Type
